channel.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
channel.description:
![](upload://7ZrxriwUhUmkPb6oC1woNZh8QBz.jpeg)
The DX11 Ultra Upgrade is a free visual improvement add-on introducing DirectX 11 support as well as a wealth of graphical improvements and performance optimization for both DX11 and DX9 API's.
When using the new “Ultra” spec, DX9 platforms will benefit from real-time local reflections and contact shadows. The owners of DX11 platforms, in addition, will be able to enjoy hardware tessellation (requires the installation of the “DX11 Ultra Upgrade”), parallax occlusion mapping and several improvements for shadows, water, particles, depth of field and motion blur.
[url]https://www.mycrysis.com/dx11[/url]
[b]DX11 Ultra Upgrade[/size][/b]
This free package enables the full DX11 feature set for Crysis 2 such as Tessellation and Displacement Mapping, Realistic Shadows with Variable Penumbra and much more for an outstanding visual experience. A DirectX 11 capable system is required.
[url=https://static.cdn.ea.com/crytek/u/f/crysis2/Crysis_2_DX11_Pack.exe]Direct Download Link[/url]
[b]High Res Textures[/size][/b]
This package provides higher texture resolution for a wide variety of assets. It supports both the DirectX 11 and DirectX 9 versions of Crysis 2. A 64-bit operating system and a graphics card with at least 768 MB of memory are required.
[url=https://static.cdn.ea.com/crytek/u/f/crysis2/Crysis_2_HiResTexture_Pack.exe]Direct Download Link[/url]
[b]Useful Links[/size][/b]
[url=https://secure.mycrysis.com/forums/viewtopic.php?f=27&t=32062]Crysis 2 Patch 1.9 FAQ[/url]
[b]Comparison Shots[/size][/b]
![](upload://uemdz4VoiSyam37JukWOKYaedQx.gif)
![](upload://tegDIg7vbfdQvsxa5rpmvbAaPTk.gif)
![](upload://qy7LaGr9Ljpleoofoc5s0pXycdw.gif)
![](upload://agLPymLwF9lfoWQvfy3FdIAyTYz.gif)
![](upload://fOcTaShewqyp0sYZ1UuO0om2tTp.gif)
![](upload://6VVvmAZdaL2YmT8qeC2kPa6w9GO.gif)
[b]Videos[/size][/b]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=urksekIR5hA]Crysis 2: Ultra Upgrade - DirectX 11 Trailer[/url]

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: Ibanez
item.description:
I’ve been watching that guy’s videos all night. He’s fucking incredible at that game. He doesn’t even fuck up like I do when I play the game… I always get flanked and shat on, but that guy knows how to escape from everything. He makes it look easy.

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
C2 was exciting when it got leaked, then the retail was less exciting due to it being so similar to the leak, infact it was the same game, except the leak had a jumpy camera during cut scenes and some dead npc’s were stuck in “civilian” position instead of, well, being dead, which didn’t affect the game because that only happened to NPC’s that were dead from the level start.

Read full topic
item.source: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: KurtyBird
item.description:
Lol, agreeing with whoever said this, but mostly everyone are damn complainers. This game still looks fucking sexy.

I’ve been hearing everyone say how bad it is, but still I just bought it yesterday and all I can say its a solid game. Its not as bad as I thought it would be…

And maybe its just me but I seriously think Crysis 1 is boring as hell. I’d rather have a “linear” campaign than wander around in a jungle trying to find some koreans to strangle.

Nothing wrong with this game except for the ai sometimes (guy threw grenade and walked into it)

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
i downloaded the update. didn’t help at all. I was hoping the better graphics would at least give me some motivation to complete the game again but either the graphics weren’t improved much at all or the game is so bad to begin with that it didn’t matter, I barely played 10 minutes without quitting from boredom…
What a shame, too. Crysis 1 is one of my favorite games of all time and Crysis 2 is less enjoyable to me than Call of Duty.

Read full topic

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
Crysis 2 sans texture pack runs significantly faster than Crysis for me. Like 10fps faster at similar settings. If you can run Crysis on high, you can probably run Crysis 2 on high.

item.description:
poptartfrommars:

I have tried it after a little bit of research I think its not the card just my slow processor.

I got an i7 920, not overclocked though. Crysis 1 runs great on high-ish settings @ 1920x1080 so perhaps I can at least stay around the medium settings in C2.

Read full topic
item.source: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released

item.title: Crysis 2 DX11 Tessellation Pack/High Res Textures Released
item.dc:creator: double-z
item.description:
This post made my OCD twitch. The first picture. The brick wall. The brick textures aren’t lined up with the ones in the hole for the window twitches Perhaps I’ve been doing 3D work too long.

Those real-time reflections are fantastic. I remember years ago wishing things reflected, wishing things could cast real shadows in games. First time I saw the Doom 3 demo with real shadows, I was really pleased. These little things really increase the realism. Real-time global illumination and radiosity next. We have almost approached the point where a movie will be entirely made in a computer game (Cryengine, UDK, etc).

Wish I had a better computer at home. I’ve got a craptop, while I’ve got a bank of dual-quad xeon machines (EDIT: at work). Time for an upgrade, I think.

Read full topic
